messages.message: also these two UI’s look nearly identical (chatbot vs converse). I really struggled to figure out what I was looking at
@avi’s team is working on UX improvements around chatbots I believe

The argument is that when you're querying a knowledge base, you can much more about the query than visibly seeing the knowledge base. Of course you can expand and open the doc from provenance if you like.
It will also help differentiate UI to your point :slightly_smiling_face:

also is it necessary to have “edit chatbot details” and “edit chatbot” as separate buttons? I understand they’re separate things but as a user it’s not clear what the difference is. I think maybe the copy should be changed?

BTW I like what you're after with a visualiser chatbot. Eventually want to extend chatbots to be able to achieve more workflow like tasks.
• https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1285
• [EPD-1843] Actions and plugins framework for chatbots - Jira (atlassian.net (http://atlassian.net)) (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1843)
Yeah "Edit Chatbot" really is "Update knowledge base"
